abstract.p: Atlantic Southeast Airlines, defying voluntary ban on flights between midnight and 6:30 AM, plans 5:59 AM flight to Atlanta from Westchester County Airport (S)

block.p: Starting next month, Atlantic Southeast Airlines is planning 5:59 a.m. flights to Atlanta from Westchester County Airport, defying a voluntary ban on flights between midnight and 6:30 a.m. Out of concern for the airport's neighbors, county officials are urging the airline, a subsidiary of Delta Airlines, to reconsider. ''Legally, the airline has a right to do this,'' said Susan Tolchin, a spokeswoman for County Executive Andrew J. Spano. ''We want to come up with a course of action to mobilize public pressure.'' Atlantic Southeast said it sought a 5:59 slot so passengers could reach Atlanta to make other flights. Currently, the airline's earliest flights are at 10:29 a.m.
